About Me

I am a Systems Engineer, passionate about health research and computing. I studied my undergraduate degree at the Universidad de los Llanos, in Villavicencio, Colombia, and from there I ventured into the areas of applied health engineering knowledge. I started with simple applications of cancer tissue classification in breast cancer, exploring different machine learning techniques, and then focused my efforts on training convolutional neural network models.

The experience would lead me to decide to study a master's degree in this area. I completed my postgraduate studies in Biomedical Engineering at the Universidad Nacional de Colombia, working mainly on characterizing histological subtypes of lung cancer. During my studies, I was part of a large research project in digital pathology, mainly as a developer of a prototype web-based histopathology image viewer, with support for remote access to different high-resolution cancer images.

I am currently studying a PhD in Engineering, also at the Universidad Nacional de Colombia, focusing my thesis on the early characterization of premalignant lesions of gastric cancer with histopathology images. There is still a long way to go.

When I'm not studying, which seems like all the time, I like to cook new recipes, travel and be in contact with nature, play video games, and spend time with my family and friends.

Cooking

I like to cook, I am always looking for recipes. I take my time, cooking a new recipe is a task of patience and practice, but equally relaxing. I am in a constant search to perfect pizza from scratch.

Hobbies

I am passionate about travel and nature. I like to photograph flowers, landscape and taste local dishes if I have the opportunity.

Santander, Colombia

Chicamocha Canyon. Silver thread on a full moon night in the mountain range.
